description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demonstrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
descriptionMD: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demonstrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
name: CCNA Security (2018)
subtitle: Cisco Certified Network Associate Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the cia triad and siem technology.  They describe the components and purpose of the CIA triad and provide examples for each component.  Also they take the time to describe SIEM technology and talk about what it does and should perform: aggregation, correlation and retention.
episodes.title: Describe CIA Triad and SIEM Technology

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the cia triad and siem technology.  They describe the components and purpose of the CIA triad and provide examples for each component.  Also they take the time to describe SIEM technology and talk about what it does and should perform: aggregation, correlation and retention.
episodes.title: Describe CIA Triad and SIEM Technology Pt2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss common security terms which the security analyst should know for the exam but as foundational knowledge before the deeper dive into network security implementations.
episodes.title: Identify Common Security Terms

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review reconnaissance attack methods.  They describe the use of this attack and some of the methods of attack. The team emphasizes the need for the IT security professional to be aware of these
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review some of most common network security attacks that a security analyst should be able to identify and understand their basic function.  The team help to define not only the categories of attacks but also some specific attacks that IT Security pros should be able to understand.
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review some of most common network security attacks that a security analyst should be able to identify and understand their basic function.  The team help to define not only the categories of attacks but also some specific attacks that IT Security pros should be able to understand.
episodes.title: Describe Common Network Attacks Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie identify common malware types. The team discuss their basic working and some of the different examples of them.  They discuss the changes in how malware has been used in the past vs today.
episodes.title: Identify Common Malware Types

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a look at different ways in which data can be removed from an organization.  They discuss the purpose of DLP.  How those policies are key for an organization today.
episodes.title: Classify Data Loss Vectors

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss encryption methods.  They review their purpose in security and the different types of encryptions used.  They discuss how they function and why they are used.
episodes.title: Describe Encryption Methods

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss encryption methods.  They review their purpose in security and the different types of encryptions used.  They discuss how they function and why they are used.
episodes.title: Describe Encryption Methods Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a little bit of time to describe the process of crypto key exchange.  The discuss why it matters and how important it is to keep the keys private. They also describe how digitial signature are created and what protectiosn it affords as well as the issuance of certificates and the PKI.
episodes.title: Describe Crypto Key Exchange

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take a little bit of time to describe the process of crypto key exchange.  The discuss why it matters and how important it is to keep the keys private. They also describe how digitial signature are created and what protectiosn it affords as well as the issuance of certificates and the PKI.
episodes.title: Describe Crypto Key Exchange Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie take the time to review some network topologies.  They discuss the need to understand the topology to help with the identifying the scope for the IT security professsional.  The describe each type and some of the details of each topology.
episodes.title: Describe Network Topologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie pick up from where they left off in part 1. The team discuss the SOHO and Cloud topologies.  They review the security of virtual environments and discuss who is responsible for the security in these types of enivironments.
episodes.title: Describe Network Topologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie discuss the methods of managing networking equipment. The describe and compare both in-band and out-of-band management of devices. They take a look at both approaches and then also demonstrate what is normally meant by both.
episodes.title: Compare In-band and Out-of-band Mgmt

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to configure and verify secure management.  They demonstrate how to use the autosecure feature using `auto secure` and walk through the configuration setup
episodes.title: Configure and Verify Secure Mgmt

episodes.description: Description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to configure and verify secure management.  They demonstrate how to use the autosecure feature using `auto secure` and walk through the configuration setup.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify Secure Mgmt Part 2

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to secre access to the management plane.  They discuss the configuration and different ways this controls access to the management plane.  The team then configures a router for secure access and how to protect the router from deletion of the Cisco IOS.
episodes.title: Secure Management Plane Access

episodes.description: In this epsiode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to secre access to the management plane.  They discuss the configuration and different ways this controls access to the management plane.  The team then configures a router for secure access and how to protect the router from deletion of the Cisco IOS.
episodes.title: Secure Management Plane Access Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review the SNMP versions briefly and discuss the advantages of SNMPv3 over the other versions. The team discuss briefly the SNMPv3 components. They configure SNMPv3 with an access control list to secure SNMP and verify its operation.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify SNMPv3

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain the importance of NTP.  The team also discuss some of the issues with NTP and how it works.  Lastly, they configure and verify how NTP can be configured with security.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify NTP Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain the importance of NTP.  The team also discuss some of the issues with NTP and how it works.  Lastly, they configure and verify how NTP can be configured with security.
episodes.title: Configure and Verify NTP Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the AAA frame work used for securing access. The guys describe basic access, local security and aaa new-model.  They compare RADIUS and TACACS+ attributes.
episodes.title: Describe AAA Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the drawbacks of local authentication.  They show how to overcomes some of these drawbacks by using a remote authentication server like tacacs+.  They demonstrate how to configure the router to use TACACS+ with a TACACS+ server and verify it for authentication and authorization
episodes.title: Configure Access Using TACACSplus

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the drawbacks of local authentication.  They show how to overcomes some of these drawbacks by using a remote authentication server like tacacs+.  They demonstrate how to configure the router to use TACACS+ with a TACACS+ server and verify it for authentication and authorization
episodes.title: Configure Access Using TACACSplus Part 2

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the need to transfer files. They discuss the need to use more secure way to transfer files.  Using NYEDGE2, they configure NYEDGE2 as the SCP server and PLABCSCO01 as the SCP client and show how to transfer a file using SCP.
episodes.title: Use SCP For File Transfer

episodes.description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demostrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
episodes.title: Explain AD Integration With AAA

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the need and uses of ISE for Network Access Control.  The guys breakdown what it can do and how it works.  The team also point out the use of Cisco's ACS server by comparison and it's working. Also noted is that the ACS is at the end of life as a product for Cisco now.
episodes.title: Describe Using Cisco ACS and ISE

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss 802.1x Port-Based Authentication.  They discuss how it restricts unauthorized clients from connecting through publicly accessible ports. The team show how to configure a router for 802.1x authentication.
episodes.title: Identify 802.1x Components and Functions

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie disucss the basics of BYOB.  They describe the need for it as well as the purpose of the Cisco BYOB Security Architecture.  Also, they talk about how mobile device management systems fit in the framework of BYOB.
episodes.title: Describe BYOD Framework and MDM

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe use of IPsec as a framework.  They discuss that IPsec is comprised of matching hashing algorithm, authentication, DH group #, limited availability,and encryption.  They describe what is involved with Phase 1 (SA) and Phase 2 (encryption).
episodes.title: Describe IPsec Protocols and Modes

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe use of IPsec as a framework.  They discuss that IPsec is comprised of matching hashing algorithm, authentication, DH group #, limited availability,and encryption.  They describe what is involved with Phase 1 (SA) and Phase 2 (encryption).
episodes.title: Describe VPN Implementations

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to implement a remote access VPN using a clientlesss SSL VPN on a Cisco ASA.  They configure this VPN throough the ASDM.  Also they verify that the VPN is in working condition.
episodes.title: Setup Clientless SSL VPN Using ASDM

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie use the ASDM to configure Anyconnect VPN on a Cisco ASA firewall. They show how challenging this implementation can be and how to reconfigure it to work correctly.  Lastly, look at the use of the components of enpoint posture assessments.
episodes.title: Setup AnyConnect VPN Using ASDM

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie verify  Anyconnect VPN configuration on a Cisco ASA firewall. They show how it use from the client side and connect to verify connection.  Lastly, look at the use of the components of enpoint posture assessments.
episodes.title: Setup AnyConnect VPN Using ASDM Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the basics of creating a site to site vpn.  The team also discusses that site-to-site vpns will not always be between 2 routers as well.  They walk through configuring one side of a router configuration and explain the process too.
episodes.title: Setup IPsec Site-to-Site VPN with PSK

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the mirror configuration of the site-to-site vpn.  The guys re-explain the process and provide guidance on gotchas and other elements that can cause the tunnel not to build.  They walk through configuring the other side of a router configuration.
episodes.title: Setup IPsec Site-to-Site VPN with PSK Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Jo and Ronnie review basic secure router access.  They show how to secure the CLI using multiple privilege levesl and configure role based access.  The team shows how to add users with different privilege levels for control and create a view for the role based congtrols.
episodes.title: Secure CLI Access and IOS

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie configure OSPF authentication using MD5.  The guys discuss the goals of configuring authentication and display how vulnerable the routing protocol can be. Lastly, they demonstration how to secure ospf.
episodes.title: Setup OSPF Authentication with MD5

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie describe the use of EIGRP authentication with MD5. They describe the prerequisites needed to setup authentication between routers. They also review the basic weakness without authentication.  They demonstrate how to configure and verify it between routers.
episodes.title: Setup EIGRP Authentication with MD5

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe STP attacks, Layer 2 Spoofing and overflows at Layer 2 The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe STP attacks, Layer 2 Spoofing, Overflows at Layer 2, CDP reconnaisance, VLAN Hopping and DHCP Spoofing. The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation Part 2

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some fo the most common Layer 2 attacks.  They describe CDP reconnaisance, VLAN Hopping and DHCP Spoofing. The team also discusses that a security professional must be able to identify and spot these types layer two attacks.
episodes.title: Setup L2 Attack Mitigation Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie take just a moment to discuss the control plane policy. The team also tell us about the security risk without configuring CoPP. They setup CoPP on the router and verify that it's working too.
episodes.title: Explain Control Plane Policing

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use of Private VLANs and show how to configure it.  The guys emphasize the terminology used when describing and configuring on a switch.  They then show how to configure and verify it working.
episodes.title: Setup PVLANs for L2 Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the native vlan security issues.  The team describe the confusion of using VLAN1. The guys also discuss the purpose of the native VLAN. Lastly, they demonstrate the default vlan and configuring the native vlan on a switch and what happens when switches have different vlans but connected by trunk ports.
episodes.title: Describe Native VLAN Security Issues

episodes.description: The CCNA Security show will build knowledge of network infrastructure security, increase understanding core security concepts, show how to configure and manage secure access, VPN encryption, firewalls, intrusion prevention, web and email content security, and endpoint security using different security technologies.  Also demostrates how install, troubleshoot, and monitor these technologies to achieve business defined security goals.
episodes.title: Describe Different Firewall Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the setting up Policy Based NAT on a Cisco ASA running version 9+.  They show of the configuration detail throught the ASDM.  Lastly, they demonstrate how to configure Policy NAT on the Cisco ASA.
episodes.title: Implement NAT on Cisco ASA 9.x

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie continue setting up Policy Based NAT on a Cisco ASA running version 9+.  Lastly, they verify the Policy NAT on the Cisco ASA. The team emphasizes that the CLI configuration is important for the exam but the viewer shouldn't ignore the fact that this can be configured in the ASDM
episodes.title: Implement NAT on Cisco ASA 9.x Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie take a look at using ZBFW, Zone Base Firewall on a Cisco IOS router.  They discuss the reason to use zones.  The team also discusses the use of zone pairs.  Using a Zone to Zone pair, they demonstrate how to configure for a zone based firewall.
episodes.title: Setup Zone Based Firewall: Zone to Zone

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Ronnie take a look at using ZBFW, Zone Base Firewall on a Cisco IOS router. Using the zone configured router they show that a self zone exist and what it represents.  If the self zone is not configured in a zone-pair there will be no connection to the router. The team also discusses that the setup is still the same as zone-to-zone.  Using a self  to Zone pairing, they demonstrate how to configure it to control what the router can reach.
episodes.title: Setup Zone Based Firewall: Self Zone

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to ocnfigure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure access using telnet, ssh, https and setup ASDM.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Access Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to ocnfigure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure dynamic nat and security access policies to allow for connections through the firewall allowing traffic to get access to a DMZ.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Security Access Policies

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie look into how to configure access management on a Cisco ASA with version 9.x.  The duo show how to configure access using telnet, ssh, https and setup ASDM.
episodes.title: Configure ASA: Modular Policy Framework

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Ronnie give consideration to deploying an IPS.  The guys describe the purpose of the IPS and different types networking professionals see on corporate type of networks.  They also describe it's deployment placement and basic functions.  Lastly, they disucss the results that can be seen when using an IPS
episodes.title: Describe IPS Deployment Considerations
